Description: Autoregressive coefficient for government consumption (persistence of spending).
Scalar constant for government consumption (baseline spending level).
Variance coefficient for government consumption (magnitude of fiscal shocks).
Total government revenues for the period (from taxes).
Total consumption demand of the general government (aggregate spending target).
Total loans/debt taken out by the government.
Social benefits paid per person to inactive persons (e.g., pensions).
Other social benefits paid per person to all households.
Consumption demand of local governments. A vector representing 156 disaggregated spending units (for Austria).
Total realised government consumption after market matching.
Price index of goods and services consumed by the government.
